intro: Tadehagi triquetrum subsp. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along streambanks. It plays a role in soil nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
